910 LOCATION (BOX NUMBER, REEL NUMBER)
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE THIRD JUDICAL DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON TERRITORY, HOLDING TERMS AT SEATTLE,

In the matter of the application of Thomas S. Brown, G. Geods, George Dowing, Chas. Schubarb, Carl Jong Matson named in the process as C.J. Young and Peter J. Wegner for a Writ of Habaes Corpus and discharge.
TO THE HON.RICHARD A. JONES, JUDGE OF THE ABOVE STYLED COURT:

Your petitonior Jumius Rochester petions the Court an dsays- That in this petition he appears in behalf of and as the agent of Thomas S. Brown, G. Geods, George Dowing, Chas. Schubarb, Carl Jong Matso named in the processes as C.J. Young and Peter J.Wegner.

That the said persons above named well defendant in cases of the United States against them before Hon. C. D. Emery, United States Commissioner at Seattle in King County, with jurisdiction to hear and try certain caused at law.

That the above named persons are and each of them is illegally wringfully and wihtout any authority of law restrained of his liberty by Thomas Jefferson Hamilion United States Harshal for Washingtion Territory, at McNeils Island at the United States Penitentiary in the County of Washingtion Territory.

That the caused and pretese of the restraint of the liberty of said persons and each of them is the alleged commission of acts which are in no wise a violation of any law of the United States or of the Territory of Washington, and which conestitues no crime, misdemanor or offense whatever.

That the illegality of the restraint herein complained of consists in the wrongful, unlawful and unwarranted defention of each of said persons named herein as detained by the said Hamiltion upon an alleged commitment issued by C.D. Emery as aforesaid, which charges no offense against the laws of the United States or Territory of Washingtion and

your petitioner futher says, that the recitals in said commintments and in each of them, upon which the said Hamilton holds th esaid persons show that there has been no crime or offense committed by said persons or either of them, and that the acts with which they and each of them is charged do no constitute any offense against the laws of the United States or Washingtion Territory, or any crime, misdemanor or offense whatever: that the several commitments in the case of each of said persons are idential except the names of the several defendants are different in each: a true exact copy of one of each of said persons are identical except th enames of the several defendants are different in each: a true exact copy of one of said commitments, to wit: commitment in the case of Thomas S. Brown upon which said Thomas S. Brown is held as aforesaid, and which is the sale and only authorty of the said Hamilton for detaining the said persons or any of them is hereto annemed as part hereof and made a part of this petiton marked exhibit and peeitioner futher says that the only offense charged against the said Thomas S. Brown or against any of said persons herein named as unlawfully restrained of their liberty, is that each of said perons, on or above teh 10th, day of October 1887, in the Territory aforesaid, disoeyed th eorders of the Master of the American ship Ivanhoe.
Petitioner says that ther is no other or further cause for such detention save as above stated:

Wherefore your petitioner prays your Honor to grant unto the said Thomas S. Brown, G. Geods, Gerorge Downing, Chas. Schubarb, Carl Jong Matson named in the processes as C.J. Young and Peter J. Wegner a Mrist of Habeas Corpus commanding and ordering the said Thomas Jefferson Hamilton to produce before your Honor at such time and place as your Honor deems wise an dmeet the bodies of the said Thomas S. Brown, G. Geods, Gerorge Downing, Chas. Schubarb, Carl Jong Matson named in the processes as O.J Young and Peter J. Wegner, and that your Honor will hear and determine whether theey are or either of them is illegally detained or restrained of his liberty and that they and each of them be discharged and permitted to go their way without further delay detention,
TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON COUNTY OF KING ------------------ - S. S.

PERSONALLY APPEARED BEFORE ME JUNIUS ROCHESTER WHO UPON OATH DEPOSES AND SAYS THAT HE APPEARS HEREIN UPON THE HALF AND AS THE AGENT OF THOMAS S. BROW., G. GEODS GERORGE DOWPETER J. WEGENER, THAT HE IS THE PETEETIN ON THEIR BEHALF NAMED HEREIN AND IN THE AFORE SAID AND HEREIN PETITOIN, THAT HE HAS READ THE SAID PETITION AND KNOWS THE CONTENTS THEREOF AND BELEIVES THE SAME TO BE TRUE.
Jamius Rochester SWORN TO AND SUVSCRIBED BEFORE ME THIS 15TH. DAY OF OCTOBER 1887.
Jacob Mctrafe Habaus Petition
FINAL MITTIMUS NO.________ United States of America, Terriotry of Washingtion, City of Seattle
The President of the United States of America to the Marshal of said Territory, and to the Keeper of the Jail of King County, in the Territory of Washington, Greeting:
Whereas, Thos S. Brown has been arrested upon the oath of D.A. oarter for having, on oor about the 10th day of October A.D. 1887, at Disobeyed the orders of the master of the American ships franhve

and has been examined by me, CHARLES D. EMERY a Commissioner of the United States for said Territory of Washington, upoon the aforesaid charge, and has been required to give bail in the sum of $500.00/100 Dollars for ______ appearance before the District Court for the 3rd Judicial District of said Territory, on the first dayof the next regular term thereof, which requisition he__ ha___ failed to comply with:

These are, therefore, to Command you, In the name and by the authority of aforesaid, to receive the said Thos S. Brown prisoner__ of the United States of America, into your custody, to remain ni confinement until__ he__ be dicharged by due course of law.
Given under my hand and seal in the City and Territory aforesaid, this 11th day of October A.D. 1887 (sigues) L. D. Emery U.S. Commissioner.
In Re affliation of Thos S Brown for Habeas Corpus
Exhibit A
div1.ab: THE UNITED STATES of AMERICA vs. Thomas S. Brown
div1.p: Received this MITTIMUS with the within named Prisoner, on the......day of............. A.D. 18....., and on the same day I committed the said Prisoner to the custody of the within named Jail Keeper, with whom I left at the same time a certified copy of this Mittimus. Dated...............18........ .................................... U.S. Marshal Washington Tex. By.................................Deputy.
In the metter of the affliation of Thomas S Brown eralfna wrat of Habeas Corpus
Field of 17/89 WELeaguevord
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF THOMAS S. BROWN ET AL. FOR A WRIT OF HEABAS CORPUS ETC.

UPON READING THE PETITION OF JUNIUS ROCEHESTER WHO PETITIONS UPON THE BEHALF AND AS THE AGENT OF THOMAS S. BROWN, G. GEODS GEORGE DOWNING CHARLES SCHUBARD CARL JOHN MATSON KNOWN AS C.J. YOUNG AND PETER J. WEGENER PRAYING FOR A WRIT OF HEABEAS CORPUS FOR THE REASONS AND CAUSES NAMED THEREIN AND COMPLAINED THEREIN AND THE COURT BEING FULLY ADVISED IN THE PREMISES AND THE PETITIONER EVER PRAYING NOW IT IS ORDERED THAT THE SAID WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS ISSUE DIRECTED TO T.J. HAMILTON MARSHAL OF WASHINGTON TERRITORY COMMANDING HIM TO PRODUCE THE BODIIES OF THOMAS MATSON (KNOWN AS C.J YOUNG) AND PETER J. WEGENER BEFORE ME AT THE DISTRICT COURT ROOM IN THE CITY OF SEATTLE W.T. AT THE HOUR OF TWO O CLOCK IN THE AFTERNOON OF THE 17TH DAY OF OCTOBER A.D. 1887. THAT THEN AND THERE I MAY ENGUIRE IN THE CAUSES COMPLAINED OF AND SAY IF THE SAID PETIONERS ARE SO ILLEGALLY RESTRAINED AS COMPLAINED, AND THAT I MAY DO AND DIRECT AS PROPEH IN THE PREMISES. AND THE CLERK OF THE HEREIN MANED COURT IS ORDERED TO ISSUE THE HEREIN NAMED WRIT. DONE AT SEATTLE H. T. OCTOBER 15TH. 1887.
RA JOUES

no 5367
In the matter of the afflication of Thomas S Brown writ of Habus Corpus
Field of 17/89 WELeugevurod
In the District of Washington of the Third Justice District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Seattle
In the matter of the afflicatoin of Thomas S Brown etal. for Habeas Corpus and Discharge.
No. 5567 Order discharging Defendants

This cause coming on to be heard upon the retrival of TSB familtion the Writ of Habeas Corpus here to fore issued herein, and Thomas S Brown, G Geods, George Douning, Chas Schuford, Loare Jong Mats on known as C.J Young and Peter J Wegner being in often court attended by their Consel Miss Metcalfe of Rochester and Lewis and Gulinace and the United States appearing by its Counsel Charles F. Monday Easy Assistaur United States District attorney, and said TJS familetion having returned said unit into Court writ his doings. Therefore and the cause of the detention of said. Defeudants herein

and if appearing to the Court that said fersois were and are illegally and wrongfully restrained of their Liberty by said TJ Hamilton and the court being suffieiently advised this considered by the court that said Thomas S Brown, G Geods, George Downing, Charles Schubard, Core Jong Matsern known as CJ Young and Pter J Wegner be and they are hereby discharged from custody and that they go here michour day and that day recover their costs herein expendure and may have execution.
Field out 7/87 W E Seugerurnd Rleel
div1.ab:
IN THE DISTRICT COURT,
Of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seattle, for the Countries of King and Kitsap.
div1.p: The People of the United States of America, to the marshall of Washington Territory Greeting:

We command you, that you have the bodys of Thomas S Brown, G Geods, Geog Downing, Charles Schubard, Carl Jong Matson, Peter J Wagner by you imprisoned and detained as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention by whatsoever name said Thomas S Brown, G Geods, Geo Dowing, Charles Schubard Peter J Megsuet shall be called or charged, before the HON. Ra Jones, Judge of the aforesaid Court at the District Court in the city of Seattle W. at the hour of two oclock in the afternoon of the 17th day of October 1887 to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Thomas S Brown, G Geods, George Downing, Chas Schubard, Carl Jong Matson (CJ Young) and Peter J Wagner And have you then there this writ.
WITNESS THE HON RICHARD JONES Judge of said District Court, adn teh seal thereof this 17th day of Oct A.D. 1887 WELeaugervard... Clerk. By........................Deputy
Writ of Habeaus Corpus
Oct 17/87 WELEAUGERVARD
